presenter.name: Tae Jun Song
presenter.title: Department of Internal Medicine, University of Ulsan College of Medicine, Asan Medical Center, Seoul, Korea

slide.title: EUS-guided RFA for tumor management
slide.text: EUS-guided RFA for tumor management Tae Jun Song Department of Internal Medicine, University of Ulsan College of Medicine, Asan Medical Center, Seoul, Korea

slide.title: Radiofrequency ablation (RFA)
slide.text:
Radiofrequency ablation (RFA) RFA works by emitting energy resulting in coagulative necrosis of the surrounding tissue.
RFA is considered a safe and potentially curative method for treatment of tumors of the liver, lung, and kidney.
It may be used as an alternative treatment method for pancreatic tumors. Gastrointest Endosc 2012;76:1039-1043 Gastrointest Endosc Clin N Am. 2012;22:359-69

slide.title: Radiofrequency ablation (RFA)
slide.notes: RFA uses electromagnetic energy to induce thermal injury to the target tissue. The RFA system consists of RF electrode and RF generator.
slide.notesNormalized: rfa uses electromagnetic energy to induce thermal injury to the target tissue. the rfa system consists of rf electrode and rf generator.
slide.notesHtml:
RFA uses electromagnetic energy to induce thermal injury to the target tissue.

The RFA system consists of RF electrode and RF generator.
slide.text: Radiofrequency ablation (RFA) RF electrode: metal shaft with conductive tip RF generator: Supplies RF power and produce RF voltage between active RF electrode and reference electrode Establishes lines of electric field within patient’s body between two electrodes. Gastrointest Endosc 2012;76:1039-1043 Gastrointest Endosc Clin N Am. 2012;22:359-69 (Starmed Co, Seoul, Korea)

slide.title: Radiofrequency ablation (RFA)
slide.notes: Mechanism of tissue heating by RFA is that electric field oscillates with RF frequency and it cause oscillatory movement of ions in the tissue. Frictional energy associated with ionic current causes heat production. In monopolar RFA, a closed-loop circuit includes a RF generator, an electrode needle, a ground pad and the patient.
slide.notesNormalized: mechanism of tissue heating by rfa is that electric field oscillates with rf frequency and it cause oscillatory movement of ions in the tissue. frictional energy associated with ionic current causes heat production. in monopolar rfa, a closed-loop circuit includes a rf generator, an electrode needle, a ground pad and the patient.
slide.notesHtml:
Mechanism of tissue heating by RFA is that electric field oscillates with RF frequency and it cause oscillatory movement of ions in the tissue. Frictional energy associated with ionic current causes heat production.

In monopolar RFA, a closed-loop circuit includes a RF generator, an electrode needle, a ground pad and the patient.
slide.text: Radiofrequency ablation (RFA)

slide.title: RFA of pancreas
slide.notes: The first trial of EUS-RFA in porcine pancreas was reported in 1999.
slide.notesNormalized: the first trial of eus-rfa in porcine pancreas was reported in 1999.
slide.notesHtml: The first trial of EUS-RFA in porcine pancreas was reported in 1999.
slide.text: RFA of pancreas Gastrointest Endosc 1999;50:392-401

slide.title: RFA of pancreas
slide.notes: Clinicians’ reluctance to use RFA in the pancreas was related to well-founded fear of adverse effects, including thermal injury-induced pancreatitis and thermal damage to structures in and around the pancreas (eg, the duodenal wall, Vater papilla, nearby viscera and blood vessels), and to technical limitations of the real-time imaging modalities used to visualize target lesions and of the radiofrequency (RF) electrodes used to ablate them.
slide.notesNormalized: clinicians’ reluctance to use rfa in the pancreas was related to well-founded fear of adverse effects, including thermal injury-induced pancreatitis and thermal damage to structures in and around the pancreas (eg, the duodenal wall, vater papilla, nearby viscera and blood vessels), and to technical limitations of the real-time imaging modalities used to visualize target lesions and of the radiofrequency (rf) electrodes used to ablate them.
slide.notesHtml:
Clinicians’ reluctance to use RFA in the pancreas was related to well-founded fear of adverse effects, including thermal injury-induced pancreatitis and thermal damage to structures in and around the pancreas (eg, the duodenal wall, Vater papilla, nearby viscera and blood vessels), and to technical

limitations of the real-time imaging modalities used to visualize target lesions and of the radiofrequency (RF) electrodes used to ablate them.
slide.text: RFA of pancreas Clinicians’ reluctance to use RFA in the pancreas was related to well-founded fear of adverse events Thermal injury-induced pancreatitis Thermal damage to structures in and around the pancreas (e.g., the duodenal wall, ampulla of Vater, nearby viscera and blood vessels) Technical limitations Pancreas 2014;43:938–945

slide.title: RFA of pancreas
slide.notes: In the past, severe adverse events including necrotizing pancreatitis or serious bleeding were reported. These adverse events made physician hesitate to perform EUS-RFA.
slide.notesNormalized: in the past, severe adverse events including necrotizing pancreatitis or serious bleeding were reported. these adverse events made physician hesitate to perform eus-rfa.
slide.notesHtml: In the past, severe adverse events including necrotizing pancreatitis or serious bleeding were reported. These adverse events made physician hesitate to perform EUS-RFA.
slide.text: RFA of pancreas EJSO 2004;30:85-7 J Surg Oncol 2006;94:392-5

slide.title: Experimental studies in animals
slide.notes: Recently, with the development of devices and interventional EUS technique, experimental studies in animals have shown that RFA of pancreatic tissue is technically feasible and safe.
slide.notesNormalized: recently, with the development of devices and interventional eus technique, experimental studies in animals have shown that rfa of pancreatic tissue is technically feasible and safe.
slide.notesHtml: Recently, with the development of devices and interventional EUS technique, experimental studies in animals have shown that RFA of pancreatic tissue is technically feasible and safe.
slide.text: Experimental studies in animals Endoscopy 2014;46:411-5 Gastrointest Endosc 2009;70:372-6 Gastroenterol Research & Practice2012; 1-6

slide.notes: In our center, EUS-guided RFA was also tried using pig model.
slide.notesNormalized: in our center, eus-guided rfa was also tried using pig model.
slide.notesHtml: In our center, EUS-guided RFA was also tried using pig model.
slide.text: Gastrointest Endosc 2012;76:1039-1043

slide.notes: Potential indications of EUS-RFA may be
slide.notesNormalized: potential indications of eus-rfa may be
slide.notesHtml: Potential indications of EUS-RFA may be
slide.text: Potential indications of EUS-RFA Unresectable pancreatic cancer Pancreatic cystic tumor Neuroendocrine tumor Hepatic tumor

slide.title: EUS-RFA of pancreatic tumors
slide.notes: Previous human trial of EUS-RFA was performed for pancreatic cystic tumor or neuroendocrine tumor.
slide.notesNormalized: previous human trial of eus-rfa was performed for pancreatic cystic tumor or neuroendocrine tumor.
slide.notesHtml: Previous human trial of EUS-RFA was performed for pancreatic cystic tumor or neuroendocrine tumor.
slide.text: EUS-RFA of pancreatic tumors World J Gastrointest Surg 2015;7:52-9

slide.title: EUS-RFA of pancreatic cancer: Human trial
slide.titleNormalized: eus-rfa of pancreatic cancer: human trial
slide.notes: In our center, IRB approved the following cases as inclusion criteria for EUS-RFA.
slide.notesNormalized: in our center, irb approved the following cases as inclusion criteria for eus-rfa.
slide.notesHtml: In our center, IRB approved the following cases as inclusion criteria for EUS-RFA.
slide.text: EUS-RFA of pancreatic cancer: Human trial IRB approved inclusion criteria Histologically confirmed pancreatic cancer Advanced & unresectable cases Failure to chemotherapy

slide.title: EUS-RFA of pancreatic cancer: Human trial
slide.titleNormalized: eus-rfa of pancreatic cancer: human trial
slide.notes: EUS-guided RFA was performed by using 18G RFA needle and a VIVA RF generator. Total length of the electrode including the delivery system was 150 cm. The exposed distal end of the electrode was needle-shaped and echogenic. The length of exposed tip of RFA electrode was 10mm. During ablation, the RF electrode was cooled and perfused internally with circulating chilled saline solution delivered via a pump.
slide.notesNormalized: eus-guided rfa was performed by using 18g rfa needle and a viva rf generator. total length of the electrode including the delivery system was 150 cm. the exposed distal end of the electrode was needle-shaped and echogenic. the length of exposed tip of rfa electrode was 10mm. during ablation, the rf electrode was cooled and perfused internally with circulating chilled saline solution delivered via a pump.
slide.notesHtml:
EUS-guided RFA was performed by using 18G RFA needle and a VIVA RF generator.

Total length of the electrode including the delivery system was 150 cm.

The exposed distal end of the electrode was needle-shaped and echogenic.

The length of exposed tip of RFA electrode was 10mm.

During ablation, the RF electrode was cooled and perfused internally with circulating chilled saline solution delivered via a pump.
slide.text: EUS-RFA of pancreatic cancer: Human trial 18-gauge endoscopic RFA electrode VIVA RF generator (STARmed, Korea) The length of exposed tip of RFA electrode was 10mm

slide.title: RFA for large tumor
slide.notes: RF ablation only takes advantage of temperature that are sufficient to induce coagulation necrosis. RFA electrode creates a central zone of high temperatures in the tissue immediately around the electrode and surrounded by more peripheral zones of sub-optimal tissue heating.
slide.notesNormalized: rf ablation only takes advantage of temperature that are sufficient to induce coagulation necrosis. rfa electrode creates a central zone of high temperatures in the tissue immediately around the electrode and surrounded by more peripheral zones of sub-optimal tissue heating.
slide.notesHtml:
RF ablation only takes advantage of temperature that are sufficient to induce coagulation necrosis.

RFA electrode creates a central zone of high temperatures in the tissue immediately around the electrode and surrounded by more peripheral zones of sub-optimal tissue heating.
slide.text: RFA for large tumor Chemistry & Physics of Lipids 2012;165:424-37

slide.title: Summation of ablation zone for large tumor ablation
slide.titleNormalized: summation of ablation zone for large tumor ablation
slide.notes: For the large tumor, multiple ablations in different sites are necessary to avoid major vessel injury due to heat injury and to secure effective ablation.
slide.notesNormalized: for the large tumor, multiple ablations in different sites are necessary to avoid major vessel injury due to heat injury and to secure effective ablation.
slide.notesHtml: For the large tumor, multiple ablations in different sites are necessary to avoid major vessel injury due to heat injury and to secure effective ablation.
slide.text: Summation of ablation zone for large tumor ablation Multiple ablation

slide.title: RFA of pancreatic cancer
slide.text: RFA of pancreatic cancer

slide.title: RFA of pancreatic cancer
slide.notes: After insertion of the RFA electrode into the mass, the RF generator was activated to deliver 50 W ablation power. The ablation was performed for 10 seconds at one site. The ablation was repeated at different sites. Initially, ablation began at the right distal portion of the mass on EUS image while withdrawing the RFA electrode, and then the RFA electrode was re-inserted and ablation was repeated at the left side of the previous site.
slide.notesNormalized: after insertion of the rfa electrode into the mass, the rf generator was activated to deliver 50 w ablation power. the ablation was performed for 10 seconds at one site. the ablation was repeated at different sites. initially, ablation began at the right distal portion of the mass on eus image while withdrawing the rfa electrode, and then the rfa electrode was re-inserted and ablation was repeated at the left side of the previous site.
slide.notesHtml: After insertion of the RFA electrode into the mass, the RF generator was activated to deliver 50 W ablation power. The ablation was performed for 10 seconds at one site. The ablation was repeated at different sites. Initially, ablation began at the right distal portion of the mass on EUS image while withdrawing the RFA electrode, and then the RFA electrode was re-inserted and ablation was repeated at the left side of the previous site.
slide.text: RFA of pancreatic cancer Courtesy of Prof. Dong Wan Seo

slide.title: 66 y/o male, pancreas head cancer
slide.notes: Let me show you the case. 66 year old mas had pancreas head cancer. Despite of SBRT, gemcitabine-based chemotherapy and 2nd line Folfox chemotherapy, the tumor progressed. We decided to perform EUS-RFA
slide.notesNormalized: let me show you the case. 66 year old mas had pancreas head cancer. despite of sbrt, gemcitabine-based chemotherapy and 2nd line folfox chemotherapy, the tumor progressed. we decided to perform eus-rfa
slide.notesHtml:
Let me show you the case.

66 year old mas had pancreas head cancer. Despite of SBRT, gemcitabine-based chemotherapy and 2nd line Folfox chemotherapy, the tumor progressed. We decided to perform EUS-RFA
slide.text: 66 y/o male, pancreas head cancer Metal stent guided SBRT (26Gy/4 Fr) Gemcitabine + erlotinib chemotherapy #4 Folfox #3 Courtesy of Prof. Dong Wan Seo

slide.title: 66 y/o male, pancreas head cancer
slide.notes: Because of the duodenal obstruction, balloon dilatation was performed to insert the linear EUS scope. But the linear EUS scope could not pass. So the forward-viewing EUS scope was used.
slide.notesNormalized: because of the duodenal obstruction, balloon dilatation was performed to insert the linear eus scope. but the linear eus scope could not pass. so the forward-viewing eus scope was used.
slide.notesHtml: Because of the duodenal obstruction, balloon dilatation was performed to insert the linear EUS scope. But the linear EUS scope could not pass. So the forward-viewing EUS scope was used.
slide.text: 66 y/o male, pancreas head cancer Courtesy of Prof. Dong Wan Seo

slide.title: 66 y/o male, pancreas head cancer
slide.notes: The ablation power was 50 W and the duration was 10 seconds. The ablation was repeated 8 times at the different site.
slide.notesNormalized: the ablation power was 50 w and the duration was 10 seconds. the ablation was repeated 8 times at the different site.
slide.notesHtml:
The ablation power was 50 W and the duration was 10 seconds.

The ablation was repeated 8 times at the different site.
slide.text: 66 y/o male, pancreas head cancer 50W, 10 sec continuous mode x 8 times Courtesy of Prof. Dong Wan Seo

slide.title: 66 y/o male, pancreas head cancer
slide.notes: The CT scan on one month after RFA showed necrosis of the tumor and some air bubbles inside the mass. But there was no evidence of duodenal fistula or abscess.
slide.notesNormalized: the ct scan on one month after rfa showed necrosis of the tumor and some air bubbles inside the mass. but there was no evidence of duodenal fistula or abscess.
slide.notesHtml: The CT scan on one month after RFA showed necrosis of the tumor and some air bubbles inside the mass. But there was no evidence of duodenal fistula or abscess.
slide.text: 66 y/o male, pancreas head cancer One month after EUS-RFA Courtesy of Prof. Dong Wan Seo

slide.title: How to increase the effect of RFA
slide.titleNormalized: how to increase the effect of rfa
slide.notes: RFA for advanced pancreatic cancer is a type of cytoreductive therapy that does not aim to eradicate the tumor. Combined multi-treatment followed by RFA can prolong survival. For the treatment of advanced pancreatic cancer, systemic control with chemotherapy is needed in addition to local control of the disease.
slide.notesNormalized: rfa for advanced pancreatic cancer is a type of cytoreductive therapy that does not aim to eradicate the tumor. combined multi-treatment followed by rfa can prolong survival. for the treatment of advanced pancreatic cancer, systemic control with chemotherapy is needed in addition to local control of the disease.
slide.notesHtml:
RFA for advanced pancreatic cancer is a type of cytoreductive therapy that does not aim to eradicate the tumor.

Combined multi-treatment followed by RFA can prolong survival.

For the treatment of advanced pancreatic cancer, systemic control with chemotherapy is needed in addition to local control of the disease.
slide.text: How to increase the effect of RFA RFA for advanced pancreatic cancer is a type of cytoreductive therapy that does not aim to eradicate the tumor. Combined multi-treatment followed by RFA can prolong survival. For the treatment of advanced pancreatic cancer, systemic control with chemotherapy is needed in addition to local control of the disease. Pancreas 2014;43:938–945

slide.title: How to increase the effect Chemistry
slide.titleNormalized: how to increase the effect chemistry
slide.notes: With RFA, additional chemotherapeutic agent was reported to be effective in the control of tumor.
slide.notesNormalized: with rfa, additional chemotherapeutic agent was reported to be effective in the control of tumor.
slide.notesHtml: With RFA, additional chemotherapeutic agent was reported to be effective in the control of tumor.
slide.text: How to increase the effect Chemistry & Physics of Lipids 2012;165:424-37

slide.title: CE-EUS after RFA
slide.notes: Post-RFA CE-EUS revealed increased blood flow around the RFA site and it may enhance the effect of systemic chemotherapy.
slide.notesNormalized: post-rfa ce-eus revealed increased blood flow around the rfa site and it may enhance the effect of systemic chemotherapy.
slide.notesHtml: Post-RFA CE-EUS revealed increased blood flow around the RFA site and it may enhance the effect of systemic chemotherapy.
slide.text: CE-EUS after RFA CE-EUS: early enhancement of RFA site → increased blood flow

slide.title: 43 y/o male, MEN 1
slide.notes: 43 year old man had multiple endocrine neoplasia type 1. Neuroendocrine tumor at the pancreas body was newly detected.
slide.notesNormalized: 43 year old man had multiple endocrine neoplasia type 1. neuroendocrine tumor at the pancreas body was newly detected.
slide.notesHtml: 43 year old man had multiple endocrine neoplasia type 1. Neuroendocrine tumor at the pancreas body was newly detected.
slide.text: 43 y/o male, MEN 1 16YA distal pancreatectomy d/t tail tumor adrenalectomy d/t Cushing syndrome 4YA & 2YA ependymoma & syringomyelia → op. 1YA parathyroid adenoma → parathyroidectomy Courtesy of Prof. Dong Wan Seo

slide.title: EUS-RFA of pancreatic tumor
slide.text: EUS-RFA of pancreatic tumor Still investigational in many areas Needs more data & refinement of devices Combination with other treatment modalities Great potential for future treatment of various tumors
